doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Jiangsu Expressway - H 1H25 briefing takeaways Steady core business with enhanced shareholder return commitmentJiangsu E_2025-08-31

passages.text: 1H25 briefing takeaways steady core business with enhanced shareholder return commitment

Jiangsu Exy's 1H25 results briefing highlighted several positive developments for the company: 1) The new truck tariff discount policy, effective from May 2025, extends a \(15\%\) discount to all trucks across China, but only on smaller roads, benefiting Jiangsu Exy's toll road revenue as its key asset, the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy, no longer needs to offer this discount; 2) Management is progressing in the research phase of the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy expansion, with IRR expected to be relatively high; 3) It remains committed to shareholder returns, with plans to sustain dividend stability and possibly explore a buyback program; 4) The company's medium- term strategy focuses on its core toll road business. Jiangsu Exy- H's share price has decreased by \(c17\%\) since mid- June (vs the HSI index's \(+5\%\) during the same period), reflecting market sentiment towards growth names. Following the recent share price correction, Jiangsu Exy- H's dividend yield is around \(5.6\%\) , which remains attractive for quality yield name investors, in our view. Stay OW.

Jiangsu Exy is benefiting from the new truck tariff discount policy. Previously, Jiangsu Province offered a \(15\%\) discount only to trucks registered within the province (affecting all Jiangsu Exy's roads). However, starting in May 2025, the province has extended the \(15\%\) tariff discount to all China's trucks, but this discount now applies only to smaller roads. This change means that Jiangsu Exy's key asset, the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy, no longer needs to offer the \(15\%\) tariff discount to trucks. Net- net, this policy adjustment is advantageous for Jiangsu Exy's toll road revenue.

The Shanghai- Nanjing Exy is set to continue benefiting from the expansion of the Yanjiang Exy. In 1H25, the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy traffic flow and revenue rose \(3.3\%\) and \(7.6\%\) Y/Y. The growth in truck traffic was particularly notable, \(+13\%\) Y/Y, raising the proportion of trucks from \(16.1\%\) to \(17.6\%\) Y/Y. Since the Yanjiang Exy (which is parallel to the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy) entered reconstruction and expansion from November 2024, with completion expected by 2027, the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy is anticipated to experience benefits during 2025- 2026, after which the benefits will diminish.

Update on the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy expansion work. Management has reported progress in the research phase of the Shanghai- Nanjing Exy expansion. The investment plan is potentially adopting a strategy of one- time planning with phased implementation to ensure investment effectiveness. Regarding the internal rate of return (IRR), management indicated that, based on prior experience, the IRR for expansion projects is at least 1ppts higher than that of new construction (greenfield) projects. As for timing, the expansion is not expected to start before 2028.
0177. HK, 177 HK Price (29 Aug 25):HK\\$9.20 Price Target (Dec- 26):HK\\$12.00
Infrastructure, Industrials & Transport
J.P. Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) Limited / J.P. Morgan Broking (Hong Kong) Limited
See page 4 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

- **Jiangsu Exy has been committed to shareholder returns.** Though the payout amount is not yet finalized, management has expressed confidence in their ability to sustain dividend stability, drawing from accumulated cash and undistributed profits. Additionally, they plan to outperform their dividend strategy vs peer to maintain a leading position in the industry regarding payout. Jiangsu Exy is also exploring other methods of shareholder return, and we believe that management may consider implementing a buyback program.

- **The medium-term strategy emphasizes the core toll road business.** For the medium term, Jiangsu Exy plans to concentrate more on its core toll road operations, with management indicating that they will not actively invest in the finance industry or pursue additional land acquisitions for the property business. The focus will remain on the southern Jiangsu province, which is more affluent. Regarding the acquisition of the South Suzhou-Wuxi-Nanjing Exy, management has been actively engaging in discussions with the provincial government and is keen to continue investing in this area.

Jiangsu Expressway - H (Overweight; Price Target: HK\(12.00)

We are optimistic on this sector and Jiangsu Exy- H, given: 1) an improved outlook for the core tollroad business; 2) reduced regulatory risk, with scope for improvement in the regulatory environment amid leadership changes; and 3) attractive valuation with a steadily growing dividend per share (DPS) profile, offering defensive returns amid rising market volatility. Jiangsu Exy has expanded into the new energy sector as an additional growth avenue, with the YS Energy acquisition profit- and value- accretive. Jiangsu Exy has kept a steady payout since listing, a very strong track record in the sector. For Chinese tollroads, we see rising visibility for meaningful concession extensions (up to 40 years) as well as prospective tariff hikes, as affirmed by our recent discussions with the listed Chinese tollroad operators, as all of them are in the process of changing their capital allocation plans, with an apparent pick- up in interest in reinvesting back into their existing tollroad assets in a bid for concession extension.

We use a DCF valuation to derive our Dec- 26 PT of \(\mathrm{HK}\) \(12.0\) . We assume a WACC of \(5.6\%\) based on a cost of equity of \(6.7\%\) (beta \(= 0.5x\) , based on the latest Bloomberg number), and after- tax cost of debt of \(3.0\%\) and target gearing of \(30\%\) . Terminal growth \(= 0\%\) .

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website,
https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
